I personally think, this game has been looking old, when it was released. But why is it still so awesome?

1. Simplistic gameplay: Originated from a UT mod, KF didnt relied on a fancy campaign, cutscenes and great story. It wanted to be a game about silly creatures and how you kill them and it does that really fine. Grabbing a weapon, looking for a good camping spot and waiting for the ZEDs...or just charging into them, screaming like an idiot.
You dont have abilitys, (real) classes or upgrades, you just choose a weapon type and a strategy and try to kill them all and stay alive. Maybe too simple for many people, but still a challenging good game concept.
2. The game is hard: Not hard in "you need a few trys or lower the difficulty", its "oh you just joined? Let me grab you by your balls and throw you around the room!". Having beginner as the easiest difficulty, the next one "normal" is already bonecrushing for new players. You can easily see that on free weekends. A lobby spawns full of lvl 0 - 3, the game starts, they rush in and die, next round, repeat. Every weapon seems to be weak until you understand it, perks like the berserker, a suicide for beginners, is the ultimate cheat perk for experienced players. Beside the leveling, that truely increases your strengh, you really can tell the difference between a new guy and a veteran.
You have to understand the concept, understand the rules of the game and learn the tactics, to survive.
It is not about getting the most kills, its about being the last one standing. If you start to care for being the one with the most kills, go for the next higher difficulty
3. A lot of different enemys: Having quite a lot of cannon fodder, every enemy, even the small ones have their purpose. The clots slow you down and block your escape routes, the reds slash you in the back, if you run like a fool, the crawlers are just like ninjas from hell (you have to experience the pain yourself) and the stalkers make demoltions blow up themselves.
The big ones seperate the newbs from the veterans. A lot of new guys die from the ZED with the chainsaw. Why? There is something in the brain of new players, that tells them, they are kings and can gun everything down, that moves. The scrake is maybe the first enemy, that teaches them, to rely on tactics and teammates. He will follow you slowly and swing his chainsaw, but still is no real danger, as long as you are not cornered. Still he kills a lot of newbis. Why? Because if he gets under 50% he will get mad as hell and will charge at you until one of you is dead. So, having a lot of hitpoints, he is the perfect deathtrap for players who arent used to tactics.
Every enemy is a custom thread and has to be countered with caution and thinking.
4. The atmosphere: The levels, the lights, the weapons, the sounds, the ZEDs...everything feels "right" in this game. You feel threatend by the dark environment, satisfied by the gun sounds and not starting to talk about the hilarious ragdolls, combined with the slow motion effect. If you are fighting in a dark lab, it will feel like a dark lab. A old dusty building will look like an old dusty building. Every gun sound, the look of the gun recoil, every effect of this game feels so satisfying. Unlike many games, it makes you feel, that someone took effort to make it look that cool.
5. The big community and events: Since 2009 there are still 1-4k people daily, events every year and always some new things added. The counter of guns and maps nearly doubled. With the coming release of KF2 it feels like KF is coming to an end, but still the last event was awesome (I think it was called "End of the road") and still a lot of people are playing it.


The cons: Still the game has some issues I never could look over:
1. inferior game engine: Everything in this game is a wall. Jumping on a railing? Nope! Getting on that car? Also nope! At least I can jump on those crates...nope... This game has so many invisible walls, to block unfair camping spots, that sometimes you forget to have a crawling and jumping key. It is nothing like Half Life, where you would climb into every vent and on every roof. You will stay on the ground, no matter what. And if you find a good spot, the ZEDs will levitate over every obstacle and without harm falling down every height.
2. Unlike other games no local hosting without port forwarding
3. No worldwide leaderboard (stats are awesome!)
4. AI going full retard (ever seen a epileptic gorefast charging at you with the movement of a drunken pedestrian? Moonwalking Scrakes?) Also sometimes very idiotic hitboxes
5. Totally static gameplay: While in a lot of other horde shooter games your player and not your character skills deside for your victory, a commando WILL mostly loose against a fleshpound. Having a big skill gap between veterans and newbs, you still can tell, when a survivor group will die. No special moves can save you. In certain situations you WILL die. In other games like Space Marine and Dino Horde (especially Dino Horde) you can pull a shitload of evasive maneuvers, tricks and abilitys, to save even the darkest situation. A good Dino Horde player dies, when he makes a mistake. It will never have the situation of "He ran out of ammo. Too many enemys. Wrong class". These things can get you killed, but you can save yourself out of every situation. It just will be more difficult.
If a sharpshooter is the last survivor, he still can kill everything, no matter what. Also a medic or a berserker, but a commando or a demolition? Yeah, they also could pull of some tricks, but you can easily spot the moment, when they will be dead. A game, you can predict, is a game with too simple rules.

I hope for better gameplay in Killing Floor 2 and will continue playing KF1 until the new game is released. You ask if you still should buy the first one? If you like a simple, classic, challenging, unforgiving action survival game? Buy it!

[h1]Killing Floor[/h1]
[table]
 [tr]
  [th]Field[/th]
  [th]Rating[/th]
  [th]Review[/th]
 [/tr]
 [tr]
  [td][b]Graphics[/b][/td]
  [td][h1]7[/h1][/td]
  [td]Not terrible, not great. Killing floor is a few years old at this point, but the graphics are still satisfying to look at. The environments are nothing to oogle over, but the game does an overall good job of generating atmosphere.[/td]
 [/tr]
 [tr]
  [td][b]Gameplay[/b][/td]
  [td][h1]7.5[/h1][/td]
  [td]A solid, fast-paced FPS. Killing floor does a great job of allowing you to feel like you are, to some extent, surviving an assualt of "zombies." The guns are satisfying to shoot, and the interface is clean. The barricade feature makes for great gameplay and intense moments, if you make use of it. The biggest problem Killing Floor faces gameplay wise is the leveling system. It is painfully slow to gain new ranks in this game. Thankfully they are addressing this in Killing Floor 2. Know this also: There are a lot of things you can buy with real money in Killing Floor, BUT, they do a good job of not putting you at a disadvantage if you don't have the DLCs. You still have what feels to be a full, solid game, with lots of maps (not to mention the community workshop), and a couple game modes![/td]
 [/tr]
 [tr]
  [td][b]Story[/b][/td]
  [td][h1]N/A[/h1][/td]
  [td]There is a story here, but it exists purely to give you a background: "Terrible experiment gone wrong." [/td]
 [/tr]
 [tr]
  [td][b]Multiplayer[/b][/td]
  [td][h1]8.5[/h1][/td]
  [td]Killing Floor is at its best when you're playing with a group of friends, trying to survive against the merciless onslaught of enemies the game throws at you. You'll find yourselves rushing to a safe place to hole up and defend, each of you watching the barricaded doors as they are slowly pounded down by the terrors on the other side. Or, you'll make the mistake of seperating, and listen as each of your friends dies off, one by one. There is still a fairly active community in this game, so you'll be able to enjoy it even if you pick it up so long after release.[/td]
 [/tr]
 [tr]
  [td][b]Replayability[/b][/td]
  [td][h1]7[/h1][/td]
  [td]Killing Floor has plenty of maps to play through, with tons more added by the community. Having owned the game for several years now, I've found that I do keep coming back to this one to have a solid good time with friends. That being said, despite the plethora of maps you are given, Killing Floor can end up feeling very repetitive at times. All in all, you'll keep coming back to play Killing Floor, but it won't be every day or week.[/td]
 [/tr]
 [tr]
  [td][h1]Overall[/h1][/td]
  [td][h1]7.6/10[/h1][/td]
  [td]Killing Floor is certainly one of the best zombie shooters out there, and I recommend it to anyone that enjoys a solid FPS. If you're looking to capture the feeling of "surviving," Killing Floor can do the trick for you for awhile. Eventually it boils down to be an FPS with the enemies skinned as Zombies. Which isn't necessarily a bad thing. If you see this one on sale, pick it up. They are constantly updating it with fun new maps and reskinned enemies. It's not a purchase you will regret.[/td]
 [/tr]
[/table]

[i]If you liked this review, feel free to check out my curator page:
[url=http://store.steampowered.com/curator/7035284-The-Tipster/]The Tipster[/url]

You are also welcome to join our group and play/discuss games together, here:  [url=http://steamcommunity.com/groups/The_Tipster]The Tipster[/url][/i]
cant stop playing it

In killing floor you fight limited waves of zombies to earn money and experience, and after each wave must visit the trader to refuel for the next wave.

This game is a little difficult to start with (coming from a L4D's background), but as you and your character gain experience at it, it will become easier. there's lots of weapons to choose from and categories of proficiencies to level up in different ways.

the default maps are very well done and most of them very big and detailed (but you dont have to use the whole map, you can stay in one place if that works for you).

LOTS of fun in co-op, and glad it supports six players in co-op instead of just 4 (yey!) !!

SO GLAD it supports local LAN play!!!!!!!!!! and you can configure map order, game style, etc easily.

i dont like the in-game bullet time much and wish you could turn it off (although, it is a tiny bit helpful when you are impossibly surrounded, but that is not often enough to like it). it dirupts the flow of the game for all players.

there are a few small bugs in the game that are minorly annoying and end up being the death of me sometimes, but I wont go into those.

For the most part this game grew on me and I like it a LOT for now. As I level up, I increase the game difficulty to keep it challenging.

I do in fact recommend this game to anyone who is looking to play something with mutants, zombies, explosions, over powered weapons, and messed up maps. I definitely recommend this game. I have never been able to stop myself from playing this game ever since I first bought it, and for a game made for the Windows XP operating system the game's graphics look insanely beautiful. It's a very old game, but still very fun to many and the addons will knock you off your feet like a right hook. Plus The Patriarch is one hell of a challenge regardless of the difficulty you set it to. I give it a 4.5 star rating. Definitely a must buy and play.

병과가 6가지에 6레벨까지 있고, 병과별로 특색이 매우 강하기 때문에( ex 샤슈 : 한방한방 머리만 맟춰야 하는 극딜병과/ 서포트 : 샷건을 애용하는 만능병기 /파벜 : 기본적인 특성은 잡몹처리와 허나이퍼를 막아주는 방패지만 무기가 모든 병과의 범주에 해당되는 무기들이라 못 쓰면 개민폐 잘 쓰면 헬에서도 굴려먹는 사기 - 잘 쓰는 분들 거의 못 봤어요.) 등등 있으며 위 조합과 무기 선택을 어떻게 하냐에 따라서 헬도 무난하게 지나가는 반면에 하드에서 조차도 헬같은 느낌을 받을 수 있습니다.
대게 무기 아무 병과나 사지 말고 자신의 병과 무기만 사야되며 같은방에 자신보다 레벨 높은 분들 있으면 영어로 "~~~ 사 줄수 있어요?"라고 물어보면 돈도 절약되고 무기도 빠른 라운드에서 얻을 수 있고 일석이조입니다.
특히 코만도 6렙이신분은 그만큼 무지막지하게 오래하신거니 그분들 플레이하시는거 보면서 하면 매우 좋습니다. 코만도가 제일 올리기 힘들거든요.
일단 게임 자체는 에임이 없기 때문에 호불호가 굉장히 갈리고요, 견착사격과 헤드샷은 기본적인 소양으로 삼는 게임이기에 자신이 에임에 자신이 없다거나 크로스헤어가 없는걸 싫어하시는 분들이라면 안 사는게 좋습니다.
그게 괜찮다면 사는걸 적극추천합니다. 비록 내년에 킬플2가 나온다지만 할인때 돈이 전혀 아깝지 않은 명작중 하나입니다.



물론 레벨 낮은 새끼들 들어오면 다 똑같이 좆되는거지만. 하드가 자멸같아지고 자멸이 헬보다 어렵게 만들면서 돈 달라고 징징거리는 징징이들 제발 지들 실력 좋다고 자뻑하고 존나 띠껍게 말하면서 스크레이크나 플레쉬 파운드 건들이고 팀 전멸시키고 'kimchiman' 이지랄 떨지 말라고.. 어차피 못 잡는거 아니까 그냥 건들이지 말고 아니, 그냥 노멀에서 놀다가 레벨 높아지면 오지 방 없다고 저지랄이니..  대부분 레벨이나 6렙의 갯수가 실력을 알려주는 지표니까. 4렙 이하는 자멸 이상 난이도 오면 개민폐인데 그나마 있는 자멸이랑 헬 방이 2명 6성에 4명  좆뉴비면 말이 되냐;;  레벨 낮은거부터 개민폐다.

[h1]DOSH.[/h1]

Here's some guns. Here's some [b]dosh.[/b] Here's some zeds. Survive.

Kill zeds to earn more [b]dosh.[/b]

Spend your hard earned [b]dosh[/b] to buy better guns to kill harder zeds.

Throw your unspent [b]dosh[/b] to other players so they too can buy better guns and earn more [b]dosh![/b]

[b]Dosh![/b] Grab it while you can, lads!

Accrue lots of [b]dosh[/b] and kill the boss.

Everybody spam B and throw your [b]dosh![/b]

ITS RAINING MONEY!

10/10 would throw [b]dosh[/b] again.
This is a fun game!

Mimo to polecam bo na solo też się fajnie gra , mozna się zrelaksować i wyżyć po cięższym dniu.
